With Valentines day around the corner Sir Piyush has to buy a greeting card . Unfortunately Piyush is low on cash. In the gift shop, he sees that every card has a price tag placed on it. He wants to evaluate the maximum amount of money he can save on the greeting card.
Your task is to write a program to help Piyush do so.

Input

The first line of the input contains no. of test cases T. Then T test cases follow.
The first line of each test case contains a single integer N denoting the number of cards. The second line contains N space-separated integers A1, A2, ..., AN denoting the price of each greeting card. 


Output
Your task for each test case is to print the maximum amount Piyush can save, followed by a new line.

Constraints

1 ≤ T ≤ 10
1 ≤ N ≤ 100000
1 ≤ Ai ≤ 1000000


Example
Input:
1
5
2 3 4 5 6

Output:
4

Explanation
In the test case the least amount Piyush can spend is 2 and he can spend 6 at most. Therefore the maximum amount he can save is 4.
